Posts.Content: Hi Hester Thanks for you reply have never tried remedies from a homeopath but any thing is worth a go!! I have already had FEC and suffered nausea but no pain there is a lot of different tablets they can give you for the sickness and nausea so just ask for them. Now I am on the T it seems that the FEC was a lot easier to handle! Good luck with the rest of your treatment GF1
Posts.Title: Pain after having chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Tinkers Thanks been to see oncologist today and she has also prescribed me gabapentin I have next T next Tuesday so hopefully will not suffer the same pain as before. Thanks GF1
Posts.Title: Pain after having chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Suzie Thanks for your reply not that I wish anyone pain but at least I know that I am not the only one going through this and it is 'normal' although you have to ask how feeling pain is'normal but I suppose that is chemo for you!! Glad you have not had nail loss mine hurt sooooo much could not bear it will try the dark nail varnish,, Hope all goes well for you. GF1 x
Posts.Title: Pain after having chemo

Posts.Content: Hi new friends I am currently in the middle of chemo and after 3 cycles of FEC which made me feel so sick I just had my first cycle of T. My body hurt so badly after a couple of days inc my feet, hands and nails I wanted to know if anyone else has experienced this?
